divs: Sighting DetailsThe star like object was at least ten times the brightness of the planet Venus with a duration lasting for an hour and 15 minutes. The object first appeared to be 45 degrees above the eastern horizon then eventually slowly moved slightly south to a point 70 degrees above eastern horizon, appearing to move above a radio tower.
Summary: Star More Than X10 the Brightness of Venus
trends: There has been one other sighting in Cicero
There were no other sightings in Cicero on or around September 12th 2007
